story:
'Poverty is not just a lack of money; it is not having the capability to realize one's full potential as a human being' - Amartya Sen

Inspired by this idea, the Amartya Foundation & Label were born at the end of 2015. When Amartya's founder Sunny realized that the fashion industry is creating poverty by taking away the freedom of textile workers, as well as polluting the environment. She started looking for fair and sustainable brands, but was quite disappointed by the result of this search. So she figured she would start her own t-shirt label. The t-shirts and sweaters are made of 100% organic ring spun cotton, and the factories in which they are made are connected to the Fair Wear Foundation. The print is also environmentally friendly, it's done by the only environmentally friendly printing company in the Benelux. However, Amartya's work goes beyond ethically made and organic clothing, we also work on sustainable development projects around the world, starting in Zambia in September. 100% of our profit is used to support these projects. Amartya's founder Sunny will travel to Zambia in September, to work on a local schooling project. She will be an Innovations Ambassador for The School Club Zambia.

The Amartya Label is based in Amsterdam. We love our canals, our people and the beautiful architecture.

The styles are exclusive and contemporary. For the conscious and well-dressed men and women of this world. The texts on the t-shirts stand for the importance of awareness. We believe that it should be cool for people to do good! We only create 500 products with each collection, which makes the Amartya Label exclusive, but it also reduces waste.

Our cotton is certified by the Global Organic Textile Standard. But what does this mean exactly? The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) is recognized as the world's leading processing standard for textiles made from organic fibres. It defines high-level environmental criteria along the entire organic textiles supply chain and requires compliance with social criteria as well. Organic cotton is better for the environment, for the farmers working on the cotton fields, and for the people wearing the clothing. Some of the big differences between organic cotton and conventional cotton are that organic cotton is GMO-free, and there are no chemical pesticides and insecticides used. When whitening conventional cotton, chlorine bleaching is used and toxic by products are released in to the environment, when whitening organic cotton, safe peroxide is used. Moreover, organic certification includes requirements for fair wages and treatment of workers in the supply chain.

What does it mean for a factory to be linked to the Fair Wear Foundation? The Fair Wear Foundation focuses on several areas like women's safety, living wages and labor standards. These labor standards are:

1. Employment is freely chosen - no forced labor
2. There is no discrimination in employment - equal opportunities, regardless of race, colour, sex, religion, political affiliation, union membership, nationality, social origin, deficiencies or handicaps
3. No exploitation of child labor - there shall be no use of child labour. The age for admission to employment shall not be less than the age of completion of compulsory schooling and, in any case, not less than 15 years. There shall be no slavery or practices similar to slavery.
4. Freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining.
5. Payment of a living wage.
6. No excessive working hours - in any event, workers shall not on a regular basis be required to work in excess of 48 hours per week and shall be provided with at least one day off for every seven-day period.
7. Safe and healthy working conditions
8. Legally binding employment relationships

The labor standards are derived from ILO Conventions and the UN Declaration on Human Rights.

The Fair Wear Foundation engages local partners in shaping its approach in a given region or country.

Finding an environmentally friendly printing company is not as easy as it may seem. Usually the ink that is used to print t-shirts is very harmful to the environment. Fortunately, we found an environmentally friendly printing company: Superette. They are the only environmentally friendly printing company in the Benelux! Superette uses water-based inks and pigments without heavy chemicals.

As Amartya Sen stated; development is freedom. I believe that the capability to go to school can give children the freedom to create their own future. That is why the first project that we support tackles poverty by making sure that children have access to effective and relevant education.

100% of Amartya's profit will go to grass-roots projects all over the world, and we start with education in rural Zambia, by supporting The School Club Zambia. Founded in 2011, The School Club Zambia’s work aims to support schools to become self-sufficient and financially stable, as well as to tackle both low literacy levels and lack of vocational skills through grass roots, community-led initiatives in partnership with local schools.

Being able to go to school is one of the freedoms that create development. We focus on four impact areas:

- Self financing schools: It is extremely hard for schools to offer a relevant and effective education to its pupils when they are operating on limited budgets, as is often the case in Zambia. School Club Zambia encourages, facilitates and supports schools to develop income-generating enterprises designed to provide a long-term and sustainable source of income for the schools. To date they have helped to launch 6 businesses at 4 schools, including chicken farms, organic vegetable gardens, a tailoring centre, an IT centre and a carpentry workshop.

- Vocational education: In the rural communities where School Club Zambia works, most young people who finish school at Grade 7 or 8 (Primary Level) will follow their parents into small-scale farming or fishing the depleting stocks of Lake Kariba. Through vocational skills training, School Club Zambia aims to give them the skills and knowledge they need to have alternative and secure sources of income.

- Girls education: In 2015 The School Club Zambia launched their first Girls Education project, which addresses some of the most urgent financial and health challenges leading to rural girl's dropping out of school. Another statement by the great Amartya Sen is that women's education and literacy tend to reduce the mortality rates for children. Do you see the importance of girls' education?!

- Literacy development: Whilst sustainable school financing and vocational education remains the core focus of School Club Zambia's work, they recognize that none of these goals are viable whilst low literacy rates remain a persistent problem across Zambia. In 2015 School Club Zambia partnered with literacy specialists Happy Readers, whose programs have already had a life-changing effect on many young people's lives.

 

The Amartya Foundation provides more than just financial support or donations; Amartya's founder Sunny will travel to Zambia on September 30th to volunteer for The School Club Zambia herself.

 

Sizes:

Women's S, M, L

Men's S, M, L

The theme of our designs is awareness, which is an important keyword for our brand.

Knowledge is power - as the proverb states: give a man a fish and he will eat for a day, teach a man to fish and he will eat for a lifetime. Having knowledge gives people the power to take control over their life and create the life they want, which is the greatest power anyone can have.
 Ignorance is evil - this is a very important statement: ignorance creates a world in which people with good hearts commit atrocities without being aware of it. This means that injustice goes unnoticed. To read more about why we believe ignorance is evil, read the blog by Amartya's founder Sunny.

Sunny Coopman - founder
Studying Language & Communication at the University of Amsterdam, with a minor in (and passion for) International Development.

Issey Lie-A-Ling - creative support & model
Studying Media & Culture at the University of Amsterdam, with a passion for fashion.

Natascha Heemskerk - designer
Studying Language & Communication at the University of Amsterdam, has a passion for design and traveling the world.

It defines high-level environmental criteria along the entire organic textiles supply chain and requires compliance with social criteria as well. Organic cotton is better for the environment, for the farmers working on the cotton fields, and for the people wearing the clothing. Some of the big differences between organic cotton and conventional cotton are that organic cotton is GMO-free, and there are no chemical pesticides and insecticides used. When whitening conventional cotton, chlorine bleaching is used and toxic by products are released in to the environment, when whitening organic cotton, safe peroxide is used. Moreover, organic certification includes requirements for fair wages and treatment of workers in the supply chain.What does it mean for a factory to be linked to the Fair Wear Foundation? The Fair Wear Foundation focuses on several areas like women's safety, living wages and labor standards. These labor standards are:1. Employment is freely chosen - no forced labor2. There is no discrimination in employment - equal opportunities, regardless of race, colour, sex, religion, political affiliation, union membership, nationality, social origin, deficiencies or handicaps3. No exploitation of child labor - there shall be no use of child labour. The age for admission to employment shall not be less than the age of completion of compulsory schooling and, in any case, not less than 15 years. There shall be no slavery or practices similar to slavery.4. Freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining.5. Payment of a living wage.6. No excessive working hours - in any event, workers shall not on a regular basis be required to work in excess of 48 hours per week and shall be provided with at least one day off for every seven-day period.7. Safe and healthy working conditions8. Legally binding employment relationshipsThe labor standards are derived from ILO Conventions and the UN Declaration on Human Rights.The Fair Wear Foundation engages local partners in shaping its approach in a given region or country.Finding an environmentally friendly printing company is not as easy as it may seem. Usually the ink that is used to print t-shirts is very harmful to the environment. Fortunately, we found an environmentally friendly printing company: Superette. They are the only environmentally friendly printing company in the Benelux! Superette uses water-based inks and pigments without heavy chemicals.As Amartya Sen stated; development is freedom. I believe that the capability to go to school can give children the freedom to create their own future. That is why the first project that we support tackles poverty by making sure that children have access to effective and relevant education.100% of Amartya's profit will go to grass-roots projects all over the world, and we start with education in rural Zambia, by supporting The School Club Zambia. Founded in 2011, The School Club Zambia’s work aims to support schools to become self-sufficient and financially stable, as well as to tackle both low literacy levels and lack of vocational skills through grass roots, community-led initiatives in partnership with local schools.Being able to go to school is one of the freedoms that create development. We focus on four impact areas:- Self financing schools: It is extremely hard for schools to offer a relevant and effective education to its pupils when they are operating on limited budgets, as is often the case in Zambia. School Club Zambia encourages, facilitates and supports schools to develop income-generating enterprises designed to provide a long-term and sustainable source of income for the schools. To date they have helped to launch 6 businesses at 4 schools, including chicken farms, organic vegetable gardens, a tailoring centre, an IT centre and a carpentry workshop.- Vocational education: In the rural communities where School Club Zambia works, most young people who finish school at Grade 7 or 8 (Primary Level) will follow their parents into small-scale farming or fishing the depleting stocks of Lake Kariba. Through vocational skills training, School Club Zambia aims to give them the skills and knowledge they need to have alternative and secure sources of income.- Girls education: In 2015 The School Club Zambia launched their first Girls Education project, which addresses some of the most urgent financial and health challenges leading to rural girl's dropping out of school. Another statement by the great Amartya Sen is that women's education and literacy tend to reduce the mortality rates for children. Do you see the importance of girls' education?!- Literacy development: Whilst sustainable school financing and vocational education remains the core focus of School Club Zambia's work, they recognize that none of these goals are viable whilst low literacy rates remain a persistent problem across Zambia. In 2015 School Club Zambia partnered with literacy specialists Happy Readers, whose programs have already had a life-changing effect on many young people's lives. The Amartya Foundation provides more than just financial support or donations; Amartya's founder Sunny will travel to Zambia on September 30th to volunteer for The School Club Zambia herself.  Sizes: Women's S, M, LMen's S, M, LThe theme of our designs is awareness, which is an important keyword for our brand.Knowledge is power - as the proverb states: give a man a fish and he will eat for a day, teach a man to fish and he will eat for a lifetime. Having knowledge gives people the power to take control over their life and create the life they want, which is the greatest power anyone can have. Ignorance is evil - this is a very important statement: ignorance creates a world in which people with good hearts commit atrocities without being aware of it. This means that injustice goes unnoticed. To read more about why we believe ignorance is evil, read the blog by Amartya's founder Sunny.Sunny Coopman - founderStudying Language & Communication at the University of Amsterdam, with a minor in (and passion for) International Development.Issey Lie-A-Ling - creative support & modelStudying Media & Culture at the University of Amsterdam, with a passion for fashion.Natascha Heemskerk - designerStudying Language & Communication at the University of Amsterdam, has a passion for design and traveling the world.

story:
I'd like to welcome each and every one of you to the pledge drive for the greatest website you will ever find: OMG Apparel! It's where immaturity and imagination meet! I am your host, Michael O'Neil and for the next few paragraphs I will be telling you why you should pledge to me your hard earned money.

First; a little about me. I'm 32, from Twin Cities area and ever since high school it's been my dream to have a business of my own. During the years following high school, I contemplated what I wanted my business to be. What was I really good and passionate about? It wasn't until the last couple of years that I realized that I'm very good at designing T-shirts! I've used websites like Zazzle and Cafepress to make custom shirts for my friends and myself. After I started hearing about how other people wanted copies of my shirts, I started to think that maybe I was a little bit better at it than I first thought. Spending months, even years, developing T-shirt ideas in my head has been a long and difficult process, but I fully believe that I have come up with a series of T-shirts that are not only original, but have a shock and awe impact. These shirts will either make you laugh hysterically, or leave you speechless.

Helping me out in this endeavor is almost indescribable. Like most people in this day and age, I'm not happy about where I am in life and what I'm doing. Being able to change all that; to be able to know each and every day that my job, my business's, main goal is to bring other people some extra laughs and happiness in their lives is something I've wanted longer that I can remember. Funding my pledge drive will make it possible for me to fully stock my business shelves and give me the freedom to fully concentrate on giving my customers the best experience they will ever find from great customer service, the most original products, and the fastest shipping.

I'd like to consider myself to be pretty creative, but beyond stick figures, I can't draw to save my life. And I can design an amateurish website for people to get a laugh at, but a professionally designed one is beyond my capabilities. That's why a portion of the funds collected here will be going to my phenomenally talented artist, and my unbelievably awesome web designer. Along with me, they are committed to trying to give you the best possible experience you can have. The majority of the funds will be going to my printing company Monkey In A Dryer, which thankfully is local to me, and will save on shipping costs. That's savings that I can then pass on to the customer. Whatever is left will be used for the basic necessities like bills and those unforeseen expenses that just pop right up at you.

Since the website is not due to launch until mid-April, all of the designs that are available to be chosen are able to be seen on our Facebook page. The address to that is www.facebook.com/shopomgapparel. More designs are being added every week and each pledger will have until mid-May to make their choice as to what shirt(s) they would like as their reward, so check back regularly! At the time of the website launch, it's projected that over 30 designs will ready to go, including the high anticipated "I Win" series that you will only find at OMG Apparel!

story:
Our Story

My name is Scott Heath and I run Blaze-In Sportswear. Apparel is my passion and I have spent most of my life in the business. I started Blaze-In to introduce a new concept of the traditional blue blazer by customizing the lining of the blazer using an organization's colors for striped lining as well as crests/logos embroidered on the inside pockets and gold embossed buttons. We sell our top of the line, worsted wool blazers for men, women and children to prep schools, colleges, universities, fraternities, clubs and similar organizations who feel a sense of pride towards their school or establishment. We also make custom printed shorts made of a new, lightweight, fast-drying micro fiber featuring mesh pocket lining and a waterproof back pocket.

In addition to making custom Blazers and Shorts, Blaze-In is dedicated to fundraising for these organizations. For every blazer we make, we donate a large percentage back to the school, charity or foundation.

Check out our BLAZERS IN ACTION:

Here are some examples of what we can make for you!

 

 

 

 

Now, WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We have been approached by many new schools, organizations and charities. We would love to make blazers for them but do not have the resources to make it happen. We need to raise money to cover operating and marketing costs so that we can continue to make our blazers and help organizations with their fundraising efforts and to show their spirit!

The Help We Need & What You Get In Return

We need $50,000 to support our Back to School campaign and start working on the production of Blazers and Shorts for new organizations.

The great news is that we have AWESOME Blazers and Shorts IN-STOCK to give out as PERKS!!!

For a $65 donation, you will receive our shorts. Just choose the style you want and your size and they will be mailed to your doorstep (or wherever else you want us to mail them)! Our lightweight, fast-drying micro fiber shorts are impossibly smooth, out- of-control comfortable and have mesh pocket lining. To top it off, we’ve added a completely waterproof pouch in the back pocket. You can wear them as every day shorts, or feel free to dive into the ocean knowing your valuables are totally protected.

Shorts come in Sizes 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36, 38, 40, 42 and 44.

Basket Weave Shorts

 Bird Shorts

Lizard Shorts

Lobster Shorts

Pebble Crab Shorts

Skull & Cross Bones Shorts

 

For higher level donors, you will get a USA Blazer - Men's and Ladies are available.

Men's Blazers come in Sizes 36-R-S, 40-R, 42-R-L, 44R-L-XL, 46-R, 48-R-L-XL, 50-L

 

 

Ladies Blazers come in Sizes 4-14.

And, for our highest level of donors, you will be able to work with me to design a custom blazer for yourself, your spouse or your child and, hopefully, for a lot of friends. If we end up making more than 25 blazers for your organization, we will make a special donation "in your name" to your school, affiliation or charity.

Here is an example of one of our school blazers worn inside-out:

If you have any questions about our campaign and program, please contact me at scott@blaze-insportswear.com or call me at (203) 594-9666.

Fulfillment

At the end of our campaign, we will mail out all the PERKS - shorts and blazers. The shorts and USA blazers will be sent before the end of the year, so please think about us for your holiday shopping! Custom blazers will take 6-8 weeks so plan on delivery after the first of the year. If for any reason the item is not available or in stock, we will be in touch to make arrangements for future delivery or will provide a full refund.

Our Design Competition

Anyone who contributes to our campaign is eligible to enter our design competition. At the end of the campaign, we will choose the best idea for a blazer lining. We will announce the winner and share your great idea with the world! Just send your ideas to info@blaze-insportswear.com. Good Luck!!!

The Difference You Will Make

In addition to getting terrific PERKS, you will help us continue to run our business and start new projects. We hope to have our blazers and shorts in schools, organizations and charities across the globe.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • SHARE our story on Facebook
  • TWEET about Us
  • POST our photos on Pinterest
  • EMAIL Friends and Family

story:
LAST 36 HOURS: STRETCH GOALS

Our fantastic friends at Bonanza Campout Festival are here to help us with our STRETCH GOALS.

You can contribute to the school we are helping by purchasing any of the BONANZA merchandise presented on our PERKS section. Act fast. There is only a limited number of time before this campaign ends!

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello! We are The Good Collective

The main reason we are doing this campaign is to build a classroom for an underserved school in the Philippines. Ardemil National High School in Iloilo, Philippines needs at least 3 classrooms for the next school year. Some of their classrooms have been destroyed by Typhoon Haiyan in 2013 and up until now those classrooms are still left unattended to. We deemed it's time that some positive change happen for this school.

 Ardemil National High School

In 2013, a massive typhoon hit the islands of the Philippines and left in its wake 12000+ classrooms damaged or destroyed. This school was deeply affected by that tragedy and they need our help. 

Jamie (second from bottom left) of The Good Collective visited Ardemil High School in December last year to find out how we could be of service.

•••

Profits from all the shirts purchased will be used to build a classroom for Ardemil.

•••

Our team, The Good Collective is a nonprofit organization based in Toronto, Canada. Our medium-term mission is to rebuild 500 classrooms in areas hit by Typhoon Haiyan in 2013. We believe that education changes everything. We also believe that a small group of committed people can make big changes happen.

•••

The change we want to see happen in the very near future is to start building at least one classroom for this school. They lost several rooms during the Typhoon in 2013. That makes it hard for them to accommodate all of their students. This year, the government wanted them to add Grades 11 and 12. These requires more rooms and they are not getting the assistance they need.

If we don't step up for them, it may take years, maybe even decades, before they receive the funding that they require. The cost to construct the classroom is around CAD$14,000 or USD$10,400

This is where you come in.

We are inviting you to be part of this hopeful and joyful project.

•••

We created the The Ardemil Shirt specifically to raise the funds we need. We will manufacture a limited run of shirts. Once every piece is sold, we will have enough money to complete this classroom. This Indiegogo campaign will be the staring point and, hopefully, even the end point to completely sell out this limited run.

•••

A. Choose a Perk

B. Share this campaign to at least 5 of your friends or family members.

We need your help to get the word across to your friends, neighbours, churchmates, fraternity brothers, sorority sisters, Instagram friends, and Facebook buddies. Let's make this act of kindness go viral.

•••

Help us reach our funding goal of CAD$5000 so we could keep our manufacturing costs to a bare minimum while still being able to provide a quality product that all of us would be proud of.

This is our team's first BIG campaign and we are hoping that with your help, it would be a BIG success.

 

Our Collective Impact

The Good Collective's 7-year goal is to build at least 500 classrooms in areas affected by Typhoon Haiyan. It starts with the very first one. This is build 1 of 500. And this is the thread-pull that will unravel it all.

But also, this is a real need that Ardemil High School has. If we accomplish this we will be providing a safer working environment for teachers and a better learning environment for at least 40 children every day of the school year. That's a total of 64,000 hours of learning time every year. And we could provide that all because each of us purchased a couple t-shirts.

That is our collective power. Individually, we all give a little. For sure, no one's lifestyle is going to be worsened. But in aggregate, all our small sacrifices combined will result in 64,000 hours of learning time for another community in need.

 

Risks & Challenges

We've made sure to get the best shirts and prints at lowest possible price possible so we could maximize the amount given for the construction. The risk is if our manufacturer doesn't pull through with their commitments. But then, it's only 1500 pieces. So, the risk is there but minimal.

Our biggest challenge would lie in the possibility we don't reach our funding goal. This would mean higher prices for each shirt because we won't be reaching the minimum run to get a good price. We are going to find ways to reach 1500 orders outside of Indiegogo to accomplish this.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to directly donate to The Good Collective, you could do so with the following options:
(The Good Collective is a registered Not-For-Profit Corporation under laws of Ontario)

In Canada, you could write a cheque for THE GOOD COLLECTIVE

Outside of Canada, please follow this link.

Or visit us at 500classrooms.com

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Where is Ardemil National High School?

Ardemil NHS is a small  barangay high school, 10 kilometers away from the town of Sara. It caters to 5 feeder elementary schools from the neighboring barangays of Ardemil, Muyco, Latawan, Del Castillo, Tady and Juaneza. We had the opportunity of visiting them after Christmas last year. We met with the school's principal, Richard Arquintillo, and a few members of the faculty.

It has a population of 338 students from grades 7-10 and 15 teachers, two of whom are borrowed from a nearby high school.

What is The Good Collective?

The Good Collective is a not-for-profit corporation registered under the laws of Ontario, Canada. It's mission is to improve access to quality education in underserved areas. It was started in 2016 by a small group of friends who deemed it necessary to lend  a helping hand to areas in the Philippines hit by a super typhoon in 2013. 

The Good Collective's big, hairy, audacious goal is to build 500 classrooms in these disaster-hit islands of the Philippines. This campaign would help them build their very first one. Help them make it a success. Then it's on to the next 499.

What are the shipping costs?

We wish we didn't have to charge shipping costs but we did try and make it as low as possible. We can ship anywhere in the world.

What is your timeline?

This campaign will end July 5th. We will be sending out the merch a couple weeks after that. You can expect to receive your perks early to mid-August.

When are you building the classroom?

We need a total of CAD$14,000 to fund our first build. We are hoping that the profit from this campaign would complete our funding. If so, construction will commence early August.

How do we know that the goal of building a classroom was achieved?

Even after the campaign is over, we will be posting regular updates on this campaign page. You could also track our progress at 500classrooms.com. Furthermore, we will be sending you updates through email.

On Instagram, our account is @thegoodcollectiveorg

On Facebook, look for 500 Classrooms

---

For all other questions please email us at build500classrooms@gmail.com

We would love to chat with you!

Much love!

This would mean higher prices for each shirt because we won't be reaching the minimum run to get a good price. We are going to find ways to reach 1500 orders outside of Indiegogo to accomplish this. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want to directly donate to The Good Collective, you could do so with the following options:(The Good Collective is a registered Not-For-Profit Corporation under laws of Ontario)In Canada, you could write a cheque for THE GOOD COLLECTIVEOutside of Canada, please follow this link.Or visit us at 500classrooms.com Frequently Asked QuestionsWhere is Ardemil National High School?Ardemil NHS is a small  barangay high school, 10 kilometers away from the town of Sara. It caters to 5 feeder elementary schools from the neighboring barangays of Ardemil, Muyco, Latawan, Del Castillo, Tady and Juaneza. We had the opportunity of visiting them after Christmas last year. We met with the school's principal, Richard Arquintillo, and a few members of the faculty.It has a population of 338 students from grades 7-10 and 15 teachers, two of whom are borrowed from a nearby high school.What is The Good Collective?The Good Collective is a not-for-profit corporation registered under the laws of Ontario, Canada. It's mission is to improve access to quality education in underserved areas. It was started in 2016 by a small group of friends who deemed it necessary to lend  a helping hand to areas in the Philippines hit by a super typhoon in 2013. The Good Collective's big, hairy, audacious goal is to build 500 classrooms in these disaster-hit islands of the Philippines. This campaign would help them build their very first one. Help them make it a success. Then it's on to the next 499.What are the shipping costs?We wish we didn't have to charge shipping costs but we did try and make it as low as possible. We can ship anywhere in the world.What is your timeline?This campaign will end July 5th. We will be sending out the merch a couple weeks after that. You can expect to receive your perks early to mid-August.When are you building the classroom?We need a total of CAD$14,000 to fund our first build. We are hoping that the profit from this campaign would complete our funding. If so, construction will commence early August.How do we know that the goal of building a classroom was achieved?Even after the campaign is over, we will be posting regular updates on this campaign page. You could also track our progress at 500classrooms.com. Furthermore, we will be sending you updates through email.On Instagram, our account is @thegoodcollectiveorgOn Facebook, look for 500 Classrooms---For all other questions please email us at build500classrooms@gmail.comWe would love to chat with you!Much love!

story:
About this project

We created Linjer after years of toting around uninspiring laptop bags, and being frustrated by fruitless searches for elegant, functional work bags under $1,500. 

We saw the beauty of a simple solution and our answer was to create our own leather products that we could treasure and sell at a fair price—one that isn't inflated by expensive storefronts, middlemen, or excessive marketing campaigns.

We chose the name Linjer (Norwegian for ‘lines’) because what could be simpler than a line? Clean, understated and an essential part of everyday life: the name reflects the minimalist Scandinavian style that inspires us. (Roman is the Norwegian among us ;))

Thanks to successful crowdfunding last year we were able to launch our first collection and now, a thousand happy customers later, we’re excited to present our next collection. We would love your support in helping us bring it to life!

 

Our modern take on a classic was designed to be a conversation piece that can be thrown in the trunk or into a plane’s overhead compartment for a weekend. 

Dimensions 
- 50 cm x 23.5 cm x 20.5 cm 
- Handle drop: 14 cm
- Adjustable strap: 90 cm to 155 cm

Details
- Available in chestnut and tan. Black is sold out!
- Detachable hanging pocket 
- Cotton lining  
- Metal feet

View our website for more photos

Our bestselling briefcase, rescaled and refined. Sturdy enough to fit your 13” laptop but small enough to fit your lifestyle. 

Dimensions 
- 37.5 cm x 28 cm x 7.5 cm 
- Handle drop: 13.5 cm 
- Adjustable strap: 106.5 cm to 117 cm

Details
- Available in black, Bordeaux, navy and mocha. Cognac is sold out!
- Fits a 13" Macbook 
- Cotton lining 
- YKK Excella zipper 
- Padded laptop pouch 
- Metal feet 
- Slots for phone and name cards, and 2 pen holders

View our website for more photos

Sweet and chic leather purse for work or weekends. For days when you want to travel light - this purse is small enough to sling over your shoulder but sturdy enough to carry all of your essentials.

Dimensions 
- 28 cm x 20 cm x 7 cm
- Handle drop: 9.5 cm
- Adjustable strap: 104 cm to 124 cm

Details   
- Available in Bordeaux, black, and navy - Cognac is sold out!
- Comes with adjustable, removable strap 
- 2 pockets inside for phone and small items 
- YKK Excella zippers
- Metal feet
- Cotton lining

View our website for more photos

Our timeless tote bag features classic styling and textured milled leather, made using the traditional tumbling method with full-grain leather and a beautiful natural suede interior. 

Dimensions
- 34 cm (bottom) x 31 cm x 13 cm
- Handle drop: 21 cm

Details
- Available in bright navy, chestnut, navy, forest green, black and bordeaux
- Magnetic closure
- Hanging pocket for phone or small items
- Natural suede lining
- Fits a 13" Macbook

View our website for more photos

The ultimate in functional design. Card slots are shaped so you can easily slide cards out. No more pinching!

Dimensions
- 19.5 cm x 10 cm x 2 cm
- Wrist strap: 20 cm

Details
- Available in bordeaux, cognac, black and navy
- Cotton lining
- YKK Excella zippers
- 8 card slots and 2 bill slots
- Coin compartment with zipper

View our website for more photos

 

Inspired by a beaten up bag we saw in a vintage store in Paris when we were attending our first leather fair, we created a doctor’s bag with a minimal, modern take on the original design.

Dimensions
- 27.5 cm x 18 cm x 13.5 cm
- Adjustable strap: 104 cm to 131 cm

Details
- Available in cognac and navy
- Comes with adjustable, removable strap
- Metal feet
- Cotton lining
- 2 pockets inside
- Fits a DSLR, iPad and Moleskine

View our website for more photos

Our convertible clutch is thoughtfully designed to take you through evenings  and nights out. Features a smart and structured envelope shape and a magnetic button.

Dimensions
- 21 cm x 12 cm x 3.5 cm
- Adjustable strap: 104 cm to 124 cm

Details
- Available in black and navy
- Comes with adjustable, removable strap
- Natural suede and cotton lining
- Magnetic closure 
- 2 small pockets inside, 1 with YKK Excella zipper
- Fits an iPhone 6+

View our website for more photos

Only the best leather makes the cut for our designs. We use full grain, vegetable-tanned aniline leather: we love it and we think you will too.

Full grain 

The top surface of a hide, known as the grain, is the strongest part of the hide. "Full grain" means that the surface has not been buffed or sanded to remove imperfections. It is much longer-lasting and durable than top grain leather (which has been buffed or sanded) or split grain leather (which doesn't have any grain at all). Top grain leather is more prevalent on the market because it's cheaper to buy low-quality leather and buff off the defects than to buy quality hides. We like to let the leather’s natural beauty speak for itself. 

Vegetable-tanned

Vegetable tanning is the traditional tanning method refined by the Spanish, Italians and French during the Renaissance. Today it makes up only 10% of leather produced. Unaided by potent chemicals, vegetable tanning takes much longer than chrome tanning (several weeks/months vs a day). As a result, it can be more expensive…but it’s worth it. Vegetable-tanned leather looks natural, smells sweet and develops a unique patina over time. 

Aniline 

...indicates that the leather has been dyed the whole way through. Pigmented leather, in contrast, has a coat of paint sprayed on top and is cheaper to make. Aniline leather looks a whole lot more natural. 

Read more about our leather on our website.

Hello! We’re Roman and Jenn, the team behind Linjer. We're a Norwegian/Canadian pair united by a passion for design and an obsession with vegetable-tanned leather.

We're proudly bootstrapped entrepreneurs and we owe it to our fantastic community of crowdfunding backers. We can't thank you enough!

If you would like to reach us, feel free to email us at hello@linjer.co. We would love to hear from you!

Thank you!

Production schedule

When it comes to beautiful vegetable-tanned leather, there are simply no shortcuts - the leather has to stay in the barrel for more than 40 days to prepare for its lifetime with you. We appreciate your patience.

We've concluded our Kickstarter campaign and will place our order on the 30th of September. 
Dec 1: Leather arrives at factory. Production begins
Jan 15: Production concludes. Ship to warehouse 
Jan 25: Begin shipping to backers

Risks and challenges

Delivery time: In manufacturing, there's always a risk that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. We're working with a very professional, organized factory that has decades of experience. We trust them to help us coordinate other material suppliers and produce in a timely manner. We've added buffers to the lead times just in case.

Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the US, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. 
Customs: Some countries are known for being very slow with customs, and you probably know if you live in one. We're sorry that we can't put a magic stamp on our packages to help them get through faster.

We'll update you frequently about our progress, and if there are any blips along the way, we'll let you know!

story:
Good Design at a Good Price

Good design doesn't have to cost the earth, nor should a quality fitting garment. Here at T Cycling, our mission is to create beautiful performance cycling apparel at a cost that does not break the bank. Based in London, UK, we have spent painstakingly long hours perfecting the designs of our launch lineup. Not only that, but we have been extensively testing our samples with some pretty tough sportives including London to Paris in 24 hours (280 miles in the saddle), London Revolution and the London Triathlon. We also have people testing our Tri Suits at upcoming Iron Man events so we can thoroughly ensure quality and fit it just right for you.

We have been working tirelessly with our manufacturers to make sure that the best material combinations are being used to create the best compromise between comfort and fit. If you take a look in the descriptions below we will give you a breakdown of the materials used.

Performance Long Sleeve Jersey - NEW ITEM

We listened good and hard in the recent survey, so here it is, our new Long Sleeve Jersey! If we sell out of all the Early Bird versions (25) we will release matching colours to the short sleeve jerseys.

The Jerseys feature the same 3 pocket with extra zip pocket design as the short sleeve jersey. 

If you have already pledged, simply add the extra amount to your pledge, then message us so we can make a note against your pledge.

T Cycling Cap - NEW ITEM

Professional Racing Jerseys

WHAT THEY ARE MADE FROM

We have spent a lot of time experimenting with different materials and combinations of materials to try and make what we personally feel is one of the comfiest jerseys we personally have tried on.

The side panels and sleeves are made from 90 GSM Italian made Kite Fabric, which is Super Breathable, Anti Bacterial, Lightweight and Moisture Wicking. It is also UPF25+ to help protect you from UV rays when cycling.

The main part of the jersey is made from 130 GSM Italian made Ventilare Fabric, which is Breathable, Lightweight and Anti Bacterial. It has a UPF35+ rating which should go a long way towards helping protect your skin when cycling. Obviously, we highly recommend the use of sunscreen when cycling.

All our jerseys have a racing profile 3 pocket design. We also thought we would add a fourth integrated zip-up pocket into the 3 pocket design for your valuables, we know how easy it is to accidentally flick out your credit card whilst accessing your pockets. We made the zip of the pocket reflective, just to add a little safety feature into the design for while your riding in low light.

 The Range

Isometric Jersey - Teal / Yellow

Isometric Jersey - Monochrome

Plus Jersey - Orange / Navy

Triangles Jersey - Black / White

Triangles Jersey - Black / Red

Triangles Jersey - Black / Yellow

Triangles Jersey - Yellow / Yellow

Triangles Jersey - Black / Blue

Professional Racing Bib Shorts

WHAT THEY ARE MADE OF

Our Bib Shorts are made from a compression material which has a mix of 80% Polyester and 20% Spandex. It is Breathable, Anti Bacterial, Quick Drying and Moisture Wicking. It is also UPF25+ to help protect you from UV rays when cycling.

They also feature a Premium Pad which is far superior to any foam insert most bib shorts come with.

 The Range

Performance Bib Shorts - Black / Yellow

Performance Bib Shorts - Navy / Orange

Performance Bib Shorts - Teal / Yellow

Performance Bib Shorts - Black / White

Performance Bib Shorts - Black / Red

Performance Bib Shorts - Black / Blue

Performance Bib Shorts - Black / Grey

Professional Tri Suits 

WHAT THEY ARE MADE OF

Our Tri Suits are made from a compression material which has a mix of 80% Polyester and 20% Spandex. It is Breathable, Anti Bacterial, Quick Drying and Moisture Wicking. It is also UPF25+ to help protect you from UV rays when competing or training.

Two integrated pockets

Triangles Tri Suit - Black / Yellow

Marc Needham tested our Tri Suits at his recent Ironman 70.3 in Dublin! Give him a follow on instagram @marc_tris Marc Needham tested our Tri Suits at his recent Ironman 70.3 in Dublin! Give him a follow on instagram @marc_tris

Sizing

We set out to make our products available for cyclists of all shapes and sizes. People should never be held back from taking part in a sport that they enjoy because premium brands do not cater for them. Take a look at our sizing chart below! Don't worry too much about getting measured up right now, we will be sending out a details form once the Indiegogo campaign has completed.

The Price

By cutting out a lot of the unnecessary overheads by selling direct to our customers. It means we have been able to offer a price to you that we hope you think is truly remarkable for a premium performance product. Not only that, but for the early backers, we have some brilliant extra offers for backing us.

Help us spread the word

We would be honoured if you could help spread our message far and wide, you can click the links below to share on social media:

Risks and challenges

EVERYTHING IS SET TO GO! 

Our product designs are finalised and our manufacturers are awaiting our order. As soon as we get the green light with indiegogo funding we will commence the order. Production time is up to 8 weeks, then one week for order fulfilment and delivery – meaning you will receive your order in February.

ACCOUNTABILITY & BRAND REPUTATION 

Communication with our backers will be 100% clear and transparent, we have total accountability for delivery this project and have many social-media channels from which to ensure this happens. Customer service is critical to the success of our brand launch.

WHAT YOUR PLEDGE MEANS TO US 

You can rest assured that with your pledge and a successful campaign we will be able to fund production of our entire range, ship these by a set date.

WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
iPress is a simple invention that removes creases and wrinkles from your garments. Its clever design takes advantage of the physico-chemical properties of the textile fibers in clothing, creating a revolutionary new method of garment care.

      • Forget ironing forever iPress will forget the iron forever. Ironing your clothes comfortably without hating the process.
      • As easy and fast it seems like magic: mount it, put your garment and sprinkle with water. Within seconds, you will be ironed.
      • Save money: iPress does not require electricity or maintenance.
      • ECO-EFFICIENT 0% Emissions of carbon dioxide CO2 and does not require electrical power for its operation or any maintenance that depends on it.
      • Save space in your clothes line and hang it where you want: iPress is designed to hangwherever you need. Indoors as a normal hanger, outdoor security mechanism not to fly,

      • The clothes will last longer: iPress about your clothes better than traditional appliances.
      • Use it anywhere: iPress can be used at home, in the office, in a hotel, mobile home, boat ... or even on the street! 
      • iPress does not occupy space: iPress can be removed so that you may take it wherever you want. Fits in your suitcase or in your backpack.

      mobile home, boat....// if you don´t have to hang iPress, you can put it on the floor // the iron is angry, right?
       

       The STRETCHING applied to clothing by the iPress breaks the molecular bonds between the fibers, returning them to their naturally smooth state in an instant. Once the operation is complete, the fibers will have changed their molecular orientation and the garment can be left to dry normally as it no longer needs to be stretched on the iPress, which can be folded up again.

      To remove the creases and wrinkles from a long-sleeved shirt, hang the iPress up and use one hand to achieve a more uniform tension in the lower parts of the shirt and at the sleeve ends, and the other to spray it with water using the iPress Sprayer Travel or Home.

       

      iPress also could be used to eliminate wrinkles and creases of wet clothes and goes directlyfromyour laundry ... for it must maintain the stretching until the garment is dry.

      iPress is very easy to use! Only 3 (or even 2) steps:  

      1. Incorporate a garment.

      2. Use iPress Sprayer (only if the garment is not wet).

      3. Science will do the magic!

      We’ve partnered with plastic manufacturer with years of experience making industrial plastic products in Spain . We’ve been working together for almost a year preparing to manufacture and get iPress in your hands quickly.

       

       

      1. Read the info about iPress rewards.

      2. Select your favourite reward in the right column.

      3. Select your country in the list for shipping.

      4. Great! You will avoid ironing with your iPress reward :) 

       S-M-L-XL

      (S and XL sizes depend on the patronage of the manufacturer and the nature of the textile fabric).

      Inches

      Max. width stretching -  26,7717"

      Min. width stretching - 14,9606"

      Opening or stretching range - 11,8111"

      LONG (fixed) - 29,5275"

      Millimeters

      Max. width stretching with iPress - 680mm

      Min. width stretching with iPress - 380mm

      Opening or stretching range iPress - 300mm

      LONG (fixed) - 750mm

       




        •  
        •  



           
        •  
      • We need your support to offset a portion of the upfront manufacturing costs for iPress. Releasing through Kickstarter helps us to quickly recoup a portion of the initial costs while being able to reward our early supporters with a discount. With your support this will be the first of many smart designs to come. 

      • The whole process manufactured in Spain
         

       

      Our goal, like the jean hanger, will be to create functionally better products for everyday use, energy savings and convenience. We have been moving steadily towards our goal of a great product. We cannot wait to share iPress with you and release it out into the world.

      Thank you for your support!.

       

       

      Riesgos y desafíos

      In the last two years, we have been working around the clock refining our designs: numerous prototypes have been developed and countless hours have been spent making sure the iPress will be as good as we intend them to be. After extensive research, we have also established a good relationship with a manufacturer that has many years of experiences in the field of 
      Plastic Injection and is able to work to our exact specifications.   But as with ANY new product, timeline is always the biggest risk. We will make every effort to deliver on time, and could even deliver the product before expected. However, there could be unforeseen circumstances that may present themselves during early production. We ask for your patience, and promise to deliver a quality product to each and every backer as soon as possible.

      In any case, we will keep you informed of any changes. 
      Thank you for helping make this product a reality.

      •
story_txt:
iPress is a simple invention that removes creases and wrinkles from your garments. Its clever design takes advantage of the physico-chemical properties of the textile fibers in clothing, creating a revolutionary new method of garment care.


Forget ironing forever iPress will forget the iron forever. Ironing your clothes comfortably without hating the process.
As easy and fast it seems like magic: mount it, put your garment and sprinkle with water. Within seconds, you will be ironed.

Save money: iPress does not require electricity or maintenance.

ECO-EFFICIENT 0% Emissions of carbon dioxide CO2 and does not require electrical power for its operation or any maintenance that depends on it.

Save space in your clothes line and hang it where you want: iPress is designed to hangwherever you need. Indoors as a normal hanger, outdoor security mechanism not to fly,


The clothes will last longer: iPress about your clothes better than traditional appliances.

Use it anywhere: iPress can be used at home, in the office, in a hotel, mobile home, boat ... or even on the street! 
iPress does not occupy space: iPress can be removed so that you may take it wherever you want. Fits in your suitcase or in your backpack.

mobile home, boat....// if you don´t have to hang iPress, you can put it on the floor // the iron is angry, right?
 
 The STRETCHING applied to clothing by the iPress breaks the molecular bonds between the fibers, returning them to their naturally smooth state in an instant. Once the operation is complete, the fibers will have changed their molecular orientation and the garment can be left to dry normally as it no longer needs to be stretched on the iPress, which can be folded up again.
To remove the creases and wrinkles from a long-sleeved shirt, hang the iPress up and use one hand to achieve a more uniform tension in the lower parts of the shirt and at the sleeve ends, and the other to spray it with water using the iPress Sprayer Travel or Home.
 
iPress also could be used to eliminate wrinkles and creases of wet clothes and goes directlyfromyour laundry ... for it must maintain the stretching until the garment is dry.


iPress is very easy to use! Only 3 (or even 2) steps:  
1. Incorporate a garment.
2. Use iPress Sprayer (only if the garment is not wet).
3. Science will do the magic!

We’ve partnered with plastic manufacturer with years of experience making industrial plastic products in Spain . We’ve been working together for almost a year preparing to manufacture and get iPress in your hands quickly. 

 

1. Read the info about iPress rewards.
2. Select your favourite reward in the right column.
3. Select your country in the list for shipping.
4. Great! You will avoid ironing with your iPress reward :) 

 S-M-L-XL
(S and XL sizes depend on the patronage of the manufacturer and the nature of the textile fabric).
Inches
Max. width stretching -  26,7717"
Min. width stretching - 14,9606"
Opening or stretching range - 11,8111"
LONG (fixed) - 29,5275"
Millimeters
Max. width stretching with iPress - 680mm
Min. width stretching with iPress - 380mm
Opening or stretching range iPress - 300mm
LONG (fixed) - 750mm


 





  


  


We need your support to offset a portion of the upfront manufacturing costs for iPress. Releasing through Kickstarter helps us to quickly recoup a portion of the initial costs while being able to reward our early supporters with a discount. With your support this will be the first of many smart designs to come. 



The whole process manufactured in Spain 
 Our goal, like the jean hanger, will be to create functionally better products for everyday use, energy savings and convenience. We have been moving steadily towards our goal of a great product. We cannot wait to share iPress with you and release it out into the world.
Thank you for your support!.
  Riesgos y desafíos
In the last two years, we have been working around the clock refining our designs: numerous prototypes have been developed and countless hours have been spent making sure the iPress will be as good as we intend them to be. After extensive research, we have also established a good relationship with a manufacturer that has many years of experiences in the field of Plastic Injection and is able to work to our exact specifications.   But as with ANY new product, timeline is always the biggest risk. We will make every effort to deliver on time, and could even deliver the product before expected. However, there could be unforeseen circumstances that may present themselves during early production. We ask for your patience, and promise to deliver a quality product to each and every backer as soon as possible.
In any case, we will keep you informed of any changes. Thank you for helping make this product a reality.

story:
I'm Sam, the founder of Slim Bifold.
We originally designed it to help people slim down their wallets, even if they have a lot of things that they need for their everyday carry.


With the first Slim Bifold we had a phenomenal response from our customers so now with version II we set out to make the original design slimmer, more feature rich and a whole lot more spacious. Because the most important thing on your person, is your wallet.

story:
We caught up with Arjun Gowda to learn more about his crowdfunding campaign and the Gowda Slip Shirt.. – CrowdFoundme Magazine

The Ultimate Mens Shirt. Join the #TFFmovement, Get your Slip Shirt today!.. – The Crowdfunding Centre

"One Shirt, Every Occasion". Simply put, the Slip Shirt combines the comfort of a t-shirt with the look of a dress shirt.

The Slip Shirt is the first edition to the GOWDA range of Truly Functional Fashion as part of the #TFFmovement, fashion that is not only comfortable and stylish but easy to wear and maintain too.

Backing this campaign is your chance to be apart of the #TFFmovement. It is a movement towards a new era of fashion. Claiming your Slip Shirt will allow you to join the ‘Select Group’ giving you a major hand in all the future designs of this fashion Start-Up, giving you the opportunity to help create the future of fashion.

We will be offering the Original Slip Shirt to you through this Indiegogo campaign at a special launch price of $129 (or less if you grab one of our early bird specials).

For quick knowledge you can jump to our FAQs at the bottom or continue reading to get the full story..

GOWDA founder and Slip Shirt Creator Arjun Gowda, talks about the 4 year journey taken to create the Slip Shirt..

So what truly makes the Slip Shirt the ultimate men’s shirt?

Key Features at a Glance:

·  Highly Comfortable Ultra-Slim Fit

·  Slips on and off with ease, No Buttoning required

·  Virtually Wrinkle Free, No Ironing necessary, the Ultimate Travel or Everyday wear

·  Machine Washable, Line Dries in Minutes

·  SPORT X DRY Technology, keeping you Dry and Sweat-Free all day long

·  Made from high quality ultra-soft, ultra-lightweight Poly fabrics, a highly durable shirt that wont fade or wear out

·  Re-inventing the men’s shirt, Bringing a century old design into the 21st century

Never Iron – Self Ironing Material ensures a crisp Slip Shirt all the time; saving you countless hours, giving you more time to get on with the more important things.

Stay Sharp – Wrinkle Free Technology, keeps you looking sharp all the time, making it your number one choice for travelling because there's nothing more annoying then opening up your suit case after a long flight and finding all your good shirts wrinkled. Get yourself a Slip Shirt and you'll never have to worry about wrinkled shirts again.

Slip On, Slip Off – The Slip Shirt only has the top 2 buttons undoable the lower 5 are always done for you, don’t waste any more time with buttons, just Slip the shirt on and Slip the shirt off.

SPORT X DRY – Our Slip Shirt is made using SPORT X DRY technology, the same technology used in top sports wear. SPORT X DRY is a rapid water wicking feature built into the fabric. To you, the wearer, this means that the fabric will draw moisture away from your skin without sticking and will rapidly diffuse and dry, to leave you cool, comfortable and virtually sweat free all day long.

Ultra-Slim Fit – The Slip Shirt features an ultra-slim fit, making it one of the slimmest fitting shirts available. Due to its unique design the Slip Shirt moulds around your body, allowing you to show off your muscles and look dressed-up. Simply choose your usual size, either Medium or Large, and the Slip Shirt will do the rest (refer to the sizing chart). Alternatively if you do want a slightly looser shirt, opt for a size up and you will have a Slim Fit, which keeps you looking slim and stylish.

Ultimate Comfort – We have made the Slip Shirt with the utmost wearer in mind, in addition to the above features the Slip Shirt is also features maximum breathability and a Superior Super Soft handle for next to skin comfort.

21st Century Style – Since it was invented, in the early 1900’s, the modern dress shirt as you know it has been structurally the same with minor adjustments over the years. Things like different types of cuffs, collars, pockets, sleeves and fits have all been changed and brought back in endless cycles. You may think the dress shirt is good enough, but here at GOWDA we believe that fashion should be better than good enough, it should be the utmost in style and functionality. The problem is the dress shirt hasn’t been ‘officially’ bought into the 21st century. Rather than make minor adjustments to a century old design we have decided to completely re-invent the dress shirt, creating the Slip Shirt.

In addition to all the features described above, what truly separates the Slip Shirt from the rest is its ability to be worn in any occasion.

As comfortable as your favourite t-shirt, you will feel great everywhere you wear it. With the style of your best dress shirt, there isn’t an occasion where the Slip Shirt can’t take you. Besides Function and Design the colour scheme has to work too, that’s why the Original Slip Shirt is made with the White/Black colour scheme, the reason this colour scheme was chosen is White is the only shirt colour that can truly work for every occasion, making it the perfect colour choice for the only shirt that also works in every occasion.

Truly modern innovation combined with the timeless White/Black colour scheme, wear it to parties, weddings, work, business, day out, night out or even for the occasions when you hit the red carpet, the GOWDA Slip Shirt truly is the ultimate; "One Shirt, Every Occasion".

Meet the Creators of the Slip Shirt:

Arjun Gowda

A fashion designer since the age of 15, Arjun has always had an interest in fashion. Through 4 years of innovation Arjun created the Slip Shirt which started the GOWDA range of ‘Truly Functional Fashion’, amongst the easiest to wear and maintain menswear on the market.

Susan Gowda

Susan has been designing fashion since childhood. She has worked with fashion for many years and with her extensive knowledge she co-created the Slip Shirt.

The Slip Shirt comes in 3 styles and 2 sizes. Currently Available in the White/Black colour scheme until further stretch goals are reached.

Checkout the awesome perks on offer, we have worked to bring you the best price possible for this Crowdfunding Campaign and all of our prices are discounted based on the standard retail price of $280. Check out the Gallery Tab at the top of this page to take a closer look at the Perks in pictures. As an added bonus the first 15 backers will also get a bonus matching leather iPhone 5 case (either white or black).

Note for Retailers: If you wish to retail the Slip Shirt contact Arjun for further information.                           Arjun: arjun@gowdafashion.co

As with every campaign there are minimum orders to reach, we have set our funding goal at $15,000 and stretch goals every $20,000 to unlock more colours as to be determined by you at each interval thereafter. Our social media fans have already voted on a black/white colour scheme to be unlocked next, the next colours will be voted on as we reach those goals. Though the original Slip Shirt is designed with a White colour scheme, other colours are great for different looks.

Be sure to leave your ideas for possible colour combinations in the 'Comments' tab at the top!

Here at GOWDA we believe that the gift of business is an opportunity to really give back. In the words of our founders; “If you are given the ability to make money through business you are obligated to give back to the world, because without them you would have no business”. That’s why we have decided to start our business by setting a new trend in the business world; here at GOWDA 10% of the proceeds of every purchase will be pledged directly to charity, always, no matter what and we anticipate that as we expand, more businesses around the world will follow our example.

10% of proceeds from this Crowdfunding campaign will be donated to YWAM (Youth with a Mission) where it will be allocated to various missions in third World Countries. We have chosen YWAM for their high track record of helping developing countries with projects like house building and bringing them medical assistance. YWAM gives young people the opportunity to go to third World Countries and really apply themselves through the various projects and make a massive change in their own lives and those lives that they help.

How to claim your Slip Shirt in 3 easy steps:

1) Select a perk from the right hand side of this campaign page.

2) Continue onto the next page to enter shipping information followed by payment details. 

Note: if you would like to contribute extra, get more Slip Shirts or add international shipping you can change the figure in the box at the top.

3) Complete payment via PayPal using your PayPal account or your Credit/Debit Card.

DONE.

Everything you need to know:

What’s GOWDA?

GOWDA is this brand new Fashion Start-Up specialising in ‘Truly Functional Fashion’, men’s fashion that is not only comfortable and stylish, but easy to wear and maintain too.

What’s a Slip Shirt?

"One Shirt, Every Occasion". Simply put, the Slip Shirt combines the comfort of a t-shirt with the look of a dress shirt.

What’s ‘Truly Functional Fashion’?

Here at GOWDA we specialize in being one of the few fashion labels with the wearer truly in mind. We believe that clothing should be stylish and easy to wear without extremely high prices, which is why we created our range of ‘Truly Functional Fashion’.

In fashion, the term ‘functional’ usually refers to clothes that are very simple in design and easily worn but often they are not as simple to wear nor with a simple design are they ‘true’ fashion. The term ‘Truly Functional Fashion’ means our clothes are very easily worn and they are also stylish which is what men’s fashion should be. All of our designs in the Truly Functional Fashion range are created with the utmost usability of the wearer in mind, for a design to be included in this category it must: eliminate as many unnecessary aspects of a garment as possible (like buttoning and ironing), it must be comfortable to wear, easy to maintain and of course it must be fashionable.

What’s the #TFFmovement?

The #TFFmovement (Truly Functional Fashion movement) is the movement towards a new era of fashion. As technology moves ahead with wearable tech fashion itself has stagnated and now’s the time to truly bring it into the 21st Century, making it just as stylish and efficient as tech has become.

The #TFFmovement is the main reason for our Crowdfunding Campaign; here at GOWDA we believe that the time has come for fashion to move ahead, starting with menswear we are set to bring about some of the biggest changes in the fashion industry this Century.

Backing this campaign is your chance to be apart of the #TFFmovement. It is a movement towards a new era of fashion. Claiming your Slip Shirt will allow you to join the ‘Select Group’ giving you a major hand in all the future designs of this fashion Start-Up, giving you the opportunity to help create the future of fashion.

What’s the ‘Select Group’?

Welcome to the ‘Select Group’. Claiming one of the perks from this campaign will entitle you to join the Select Group. This Group is a VIP group of all the early backers of the #TFFmovement, which will give you a major hand in the finalisations of all our future designs, including Beta testing of our new products.

Where will the Funds Go?

All of the funds raised will go towards manufacturing of the first production run of Slip Shirts and further developing the range of Truly Functional Fashion with your help.

$15000 is the minimum amount required for a large production run, if we do not reach our funding goal we will still fulfil all orders through a smaller manufacturer. If we exceed our funding goal we will move towards the stretch goals as listed above.

10% of the proceeds will also be donated to YWAM (Youth with a Mission).

Where are the Slip Shirts Manufactured?

Our first production run of Slip Shirts will be manufactured right here in Australia.

How do I choose my Style, Size and Colour?

We will contact you via email upon the conclusion of our campaign (after July 2nd) to get your Style, Size and Colour Choices for all your Perks claimed.

You will be able to choose between any of the 3 styles (Long Sleeve, Short Sleeve or Sleeveless), either Medium or Large Sizes and any of the unlocked Colours.

If you purchase more than one Slip Shirt you can choose any style, size or colour for each of your shirts separately, they don’t have to all be the same.

Note: All images shown on this campaign are concept versions, the final version that you will receive will be finished with a higher level of precision to what you see here.

How do I add $20 for International Shipping?

After choosing your perk the next screen will have a box with the amount to be paid, just add $20 on to that figure.

If you forget to add the cost for international shipping to your order just click ‘Contribute Now’ at the top of the page and contribute the shipping fee using the same email address you purchased your perk with.

How Do I claim more Slip Shirts?

Either choose the multi shirt options or you can choose any of the single Slip Shirt perks and on the next screen just multiply the figure in the box by the amount of shirts you’re after.

If however you’ve already chosen and paid for a perk just choose any of the other perks and use the same email address you used to purchase the previous perk, we will match up your orders and ship them together.

What Payment Types are accepted?

You can pay using PayPal or your Credit/Debit Card.

We accept all the major Credit/Debit Cards (VISA, MasterCard, American Express and Discover).

All payments (including Credit/Debit Card) are handled through PayPal to ensure your details are kept secure.

How will my Slip Shirt be shipped?

All of our Slip Shirts will be sent via Australia Post. All of our items will be packed and sent with minimal product packaging as to reduce our environmental impact. To ensure the items are kept safe on their trip to you we send your items in a tough mailing bag (which is basically a very strong plastic envelope which is tightly sealed).

We offer FREE SHIPPING to all of Australia, and only an extra $20 for international orders to ensure secure shipping.

When will my Slip Shirt arrive?

The first production run of Slip Shirts is set to arrive at your door before the end of August 2014.

Are there any Job positions available?

Ever wanted to work at a start-up? Ever wanted to work in the fashion industry? Well, as we are a brand new fashion start-up we are always expanding and looking to add new members to the team. Positions available may include; Social Media, Production, Packaging, PR, Finance, Management, Design Analysts, etc.

Upon completion of our Crowdfunding Campaign we will be sending out an email to all of our backers regarding job opportunities at our new company. So back our campaign, grab yourself a Slip Shirt and upon completion of our campaign you could be looking at joining us in the fashion industry as the newest member of our team.

What does the Future hold?

For us here at GOWDA we have created the #TFFmovement with the ideal of bringing fashion into the 21st Century. After the finalisation of this campaign we seek to launch many new products (items including the Zero-Button Suit), first in menswear then moving into women’s wear down the track. 

Have any further questions? Ensure you’ve read the FAQs above first; if your question isn’t answered there send us an email:

Enquiries: slipshirt@gowdafashion.co

Press: publicity@gowdafashion.co

  Checkout our Website          Like us on Facebook              Follow us on twitter   

Thanks for checking out our campaign, (you’re awesome for reading down to here!)

Feel free to share our campaign with your friends and followers via the share tools at the top of this page (just below the video advert at the top) be sure to include the hash tag #TFFmovement, remember the more you share the more colour choices you’ll unlock and the more money we’ll raise to further develop our fashion and the more we’ll raise for charity!

Regards, the GOWDA Team

Note: Slip Shirt™ and all its components are Trademarks under ownership of GOWDA. Slip Shirt™  design and all pertaining features associated are Patent Pending under ownership of GOWDA.
